unnormalised: Okay, ladies, let's talk about something super important and often shrouded in mystery: Obstetrics and Gynecology, or as I like to call it, OB-GYN. It's basically all things related to women's health, from periods to pregnancies and everything in between. Think of your OB-GYN as your go-to person for all your girly needs. Seriously, don't be shy!

unnormalised: So, what exactly do OB-GYNs do? Well, they handle everything from routine checkups (like pap smears, usually starting around age 21) to more complicated issues like PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome). They're also the experts when it comes to pregnancy, from preconception counseling to delivery and postpartum care. My own Gynae prescribed me 1000mcg of folic acid daily when I was pregnant!

Well, they handle everything from routine checkups (like pap smears, usually starting around age twenty one) to more complicated issues like P-C-O-S (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome). They're also the experts when it comes to pregnancy, from preconception counseling to delivery and postpartum care. My own Gynae prescribed me one thousand microgram of folic acid daily when I was pregnant!

unnormalised: Speaking of pregnancy, that’s a HUGE part of OB-GYN. They monitor your baby's growth, conduct ultrasounds (you might get to see your little one as early as 8 wks!), and help you prepare for labor. And when the big day arrives, they’re right there to help you deliver your baby safely. It's honestly an amazing profession.

unnormalised: And it's not just about babies, alright? OB-GYNs also deal with issues like endometriosis, fibroids, and menopause. If you're experiencing abnormal bleeding, pelvic pain, or anything else that just doesn't feel right, don't ignore it! Get it checked out by a professional. Remember that nagging pain you've been ignoring since 15/03/2023? Get it checked out!

unnormalised: Now, let’s talk about some of the common tests. You'll probably hear about things like pelvic exams, ultrasounds, and blood tests. These are all important for screening for various conditions and monitoring your overall health. Don't be scared! They might be a bit uncomfortable, but they're usually quick and painless. And think of it this way: it’s like getting your vehicle serviced, but for your precious body.
